actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The Chair put the question on the motion to reconsider and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Scanlon demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Mr. Cole moved to reconsider the vote.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Failed by recorded vote: 212
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 712 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4365) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1130) to repeal restrictions on the export and import of natural gas; and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 684) condemning the actions of Governor of New Mexico, Michelle Lujan Grisham, for subverting the Second Amendment to the Constitution and depriving the citizens of New Mexico of their right to bear arms."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 712 and on agreeing to resolution, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 21.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 712, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 712.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 712 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4365) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1130) to repeal restrictions on the export and import of natural gas; and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 684) condemning the actions of Governor of New Mexico, Michelle Lujan Grisham, for subverting the Second Amendment to the Constitution and depriving the citizens of New Mexico of their right to bear arms."
The House proceeded with one-minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to five per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Boyle of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Bishop Michael E. Dantley, Christ Emmanuel Christian Fellowship, Cincinnati, OH
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
